newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold eases slightly despite Iraq crisis.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold eases slightly despite Iraq crisis.

text.p: Istanbul gold prices dropped on Wednesday despite the latest tension in Iraq, dealers said.
Gold lost 1,700 lira and $1.15 to end at 1,084,000 lira per gram and $386.55 per ounce. Volume increased by 33 percent to 1,552 kilos.
Dealers said prices dropped on the exchange due to easier gold prices in London and despite a weaker lira against the dollar in the domestic market.
The Turkish lira closed at 87,000 per dollar, down from Tuesday's 86,980.
Morning trade totalled 600 kilos and afternoon trade was 952 kilos. Of the total, 35 percent was in dollar terms. --Istanbul Newsroom, +90-212-275 0875 IMA
